messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle custom node?
The purpose of the ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle custom node is to send images generated in ComfyUI to the image management software Eagle.
What existing custom node was ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle based on?
ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle was based on the existing custom node ComfyUI-send-eagle-slim, which was created by Shingo.T.
What are some of the main features of ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle?

Some of the main features of ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle include sending received images to Eagle, recording text from 'positive' and 'negative' inputs as notes in Eagle, selecting the save format as Webp or PNG, and specifying the compression ratio for lossy Webp images.
What are the options for the 'save_tags' parameter in ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle?

The options for the 'save_tags' parameter in ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle are: 'None' (do not save), 'Prompt + Checkpoint' (save prompt and model name), 'Prompt' (save prompt only), and 'Checkpoint' (save model name only).
What is the default file name template in ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle?

The default file name template in ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle is '{model}-{width}-{height}-{seed}', where '{model}' is the checkpoint name, '{width}' and '{height}' are the image width and height, and '{seed}' is the generation seed.
In addition to sending images to Eagle, where else does ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle save the images?

In addition to sending images to Eagle, ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle also saves the images in a local folder with the path './ComfyUI/output/YYYY-MM-DD/YYYYMMDD_HHMMss_SSSSSS-{FinalImage_width}-{FinalImage_height}.webp'.
What are some of the nodes that ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle supports for saving PNGInfo?

ComfyUI-d2-send-eagle supports saving PNGInfo for nodes such as 'KSampler', 'KSamplerAdvanced', 'Empty Latent Image', 'CLIP TextEncoder(Prompt)', 'CLIPTextEncodeSDXL', 'ComfyUI-SDXL-EmptyLatentImage', 'KSampler With Refiner (Fooocus)', 'BNK_TiledKSampler', and 'SDXL Prompt Styler'.
